intro: Amellus microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaved amellus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Amellus microphyllus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
